results.title: The Devil
results.creator_credit: D.W. Griffith and American Mutoscope and Biograph Company
results.brief_description: Happily married artist is tempted by beautiful model. The Devil delights in making matters worse. Cast includes Arthur V. johnson, George Gebhardt, Harold Salter, Florence Lawrence, Mack Sennett. Silent film with no intertitles.

results.title: The Development of instruments and their music: a symphony is recorded
results.creator_credit: Alasdair Clayre, BBC-TV and Open University
results.brief_description: Shows the rehearsal and performance of C.P.E. Bach’s Symphony in D by the Croyland Chamber Orchestra, as it was recorded for the Open University gramophone record “The Rise of the Symphony.” Examines the steps taken to achieve a musically authoritative recording of an 18th century orchestral work.

results.title: The Development of communication
results.brief_description: Inventions are a social phenomena, although the influence of one person always tends to make them seem the result of a miraculous individual effort. This film shows the social conditions which gave rise to the invention of the battery, the ground connection, the electro-magnet, the telephone, telegraph, cable, and radio, thus making possible much more rapid and reliable communication services than had been possible in the pre-electric age. These more rapid communications were essential if industrialisation was to develop and expand.

results.title: The Desert fox
results.creator_credit: Stephen Hills, Dennis Tupicoff and Victorian College of the Arts, School of Film and Television
results.brief_description: July, 1942, war veterans recall the best fighting animal of the era, and a great mate - the desert fox (who looks remarkably like Rommel), captured in a visual array of claymation, stop frame and animation in this war mockumentary.

results.title: The Decline of the Roman Empire
results.brief_description: Uses actual settings in France, England, the Near East and Rome to present the political, social and economic forces which weakened the Roman Empire from within and the forces from without which brought about its decline.

results.title: The Declaration of independence by the colonies
results.creator_credit: John T. Bobbitt and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Describes events and circumstances which lead to the American Declaration of Independence. Recalls the Boston Tea Party; the clash of British troops at Lexington and Concord; First and Second Continental Congresses held at Philadelphia; “Common Sense”, the pamphlet written by Tom Paine, which worked a change in public opinion toward British rule; Jefferson’s drafting of the Declaration of Independence and its adoption on July 4th, 1776.

results.title: The Daylight moon: a film about the poet Les Murray
results.creator_credit: Don Featherstone, Australian Broadcasting Corporation and Don Featherstone Productions
results.brief_description: If there were such a thing, Les Murray would be the Poet Laureate of Australia. In this amusing, lyrical documentary, Don Featherstone has succeeded in capturing the essence of one of our finest poets, a man totally at home in the country round Bunyah N.S.W., farming for a living and writing poems. Interviews with the endearing Les Murray are interspersed with readings of his poems set to suitably beautiful images of the area and people which inspired them. Winner of the Gold Plaque, Chicago International Film Festival 1991.

results.title: The Dawn of Happiness
results.brief_description: A country as enigmatic as any in the Orient is the location for this adventure trip of a lifetime, where we see first hand the roots of modern Thailand. Starting in Bangkok, travel north upstream to Aeutia in the Chao Phraya River in search of the incredible Hill tribes of Northern Thailand, who are found in one of the most remote areas in the country between the borders of Burma and Laos. Upon arrival witness a wedding ceremony - a magnificent display of clothing and jewellery, highlighting the fascinating rituals and traditions of these ancient people. Further on the journey, visit Naoon Suan - one of the largest rice markets in the world, along with Subotai and Chiang Mai, two of the most fascinating cities in Thailand.
